title: James House - Broken Glass Twisted Steel [2014]
description:
As an artist, James House placed nine records on the Billboard country charts between 1989 and 1996, with the biggest being 1995Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s "This Is Me Missing You," which hit No. 6 in 1995 Ã¢â‚¬â€œ almost two decades ago. Since that time, he has also found success as a songwriter with hits from Dwight Yoakam ("AinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t That Lonely Yet"), Diamond Rio ("In A Week Or Two") and Martina McBride ("A Broken Wing"), so hit songs and House go hand in hand. Still, the performer tells Billboard that he received a note in the fall of 2013 that threw him for a little bit of a loop.

"Back in November, I got an email from a fan who said Ã¢â‚¬ËœThis Is Me Missing YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is number one on the UK dance charts," he said with a hint of disbelief in his voice. "My first thought was that somebody covered it. I emailed back and asked who cut it, and they said Ã¢â‚¬ËœNobody. It was our track.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ I investigated, and indeed it was number one." The success of the song made him think about the possibility of a new record Ã¢â‚¬â€œ something he hadnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t done since 2009Ã¢â‚¬â„¢s Home, Vol. 1 EP. "I thought if there was ever be a great time to do another record, this was it," he told The 615.

That project, "Broken Glass, Twisted Steel," is out this week on HouseÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s own Victor House label. ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s a mixture of new material, along with a few songs that House has been waiting to put his stamp on for awhile.  "IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ve been wanting to do this record for a long time Ã¢â‚¬â€œ with my versions of Ã¢â‚¬ËœAinÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t That Lonely Yet,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ Ã¢â‚¬ËœIn A Week Or Two,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ or Ã¢â‚¬ËœA Broken Wing.Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ I also had some new stuff on the record as well that I wanted to cut. It was just a good time. I really enjoyed it."

The singer reflected on the success of "A Broken Wing," a 1998 number one for McBride that has become one of her signature performances. "ItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s like an old friend," he said warmly. "Somebody sang it the other night on 'The Voice,Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ and they did a great job on it. You write a lot of songs, and you figure that one in a hundred is going to be special. That happened to be that one," he said.
